intro: Ballota antalyensis, commonly known as the Antalya ballota, is a flowering plant native to southern Turkey. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it grows as a shrub or small tree. Ballota antalyensis is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in Mediterranean climates.
